definition: role (theater)/to compete/ancient three legged wine vessel/third note of pentatonic scale
angle/corner/horn/horn-shaped/unit of money equal to 0.1 yuan, or 10 cents (a dime)/CL:個|个[ge4]
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: Two free internet terminals can be found in the Lindner's business corner.
sentences.chinese: 酒店的商业角落提供两个免费上网设备。

sentences.english: At last his rapier flew into the corner of the room.
sentences.chinese: 最后他的剑飞进来了房屋的角落。

sentences.english: Black Email is spacing out in the corner, contemplating an alternative life in Nara City.
sentences.chinese: 黑邮件在角落里发呆，想着奈良城的别有洞天。

sentences.english: In a corner of the room behind a screen was a small gas stove and a refrigerator.
sentences.chinese: 在房间一个角落的屏风后有一个小煤气灶和一台冰箱。

sentences.english: Move to the corner of 15th St. & 10th Ave.
sentences.chinese: 移动到第15届圣夫角落与第10位。

sentences.english: He plods away quietly in his corner.
sentences.chinese: 他在自己的角落里安静地辛勤工作着。

sentences.english: Octagon —shapedturrets rest on the four corners of the wall.
sentences.chinese: 八角形塔楼其余的四个角落的墙上。

sentences.english: The orc breaks Valeera's arm and throws her into the corner.
sentences.chinese: 兽人攀折了瓦蕾拉的手臂，并将其丢到了角落里。

sentences.english: There is a place in our heart for bottled-up memories.
sentences.chinese: 我的心里总有一个柔软的角落，收藏记忆的瓶瓶罐罐。

sentences.english: Could you drop us off on that corner?
sentences.chinese: 您能让我们在那个角落处下车吗？

sentences.english: Mr Feng was crouching in a dark corner, indifferent to the visitors.
sentences.chinese: 冯先生在一个黑暗的角落里弯着腰，对访客很冷淡。

sentences.english: Drop it in the mail box marked"Out of town"at that corner.
sentences.chinese: 把它投进那个角落里标有“外埠”的邮箱。

sentences.english: Sitting in the corner listening, watching everybody, taking notes.
sentences.chinese: 坐在角落里倾听，看着每个人，做笔记。

sentences.english: He lay huddled in a corner.
sentences.chinese: 他把身体缩成一团躺在角落里。

sentences.english: Turn up your head, look at the spider on the small corner of the ceiling in your house.
sentences.chinese: 抬起头，看看那只在你家天花板上小小角落的蜘蛛。

sentences.english: His father sits in the corner, watching, but the boy is no more comfortable.
sentences.chinese: 他的父亲坐在角落里观看，但男孩不再感到舒适。

definition: bend in a street/corner/to turn a corner
by the window (referring to seats on a plane etc)
